Activity: Arrive at the office, grab a coffee, and check emails. Quick scan of industry news to see what's trending. Fire off a quick email to @Ldes-1 and @Prod-1 asking for a brief recap of last week's key decisions and any high-level changes to the game's direction. Need to stay in the loop, ya know?

Brainstorming session. Review the overall game narrative and mechanics documents. Start sketching out rough level layouts for the first level. Focus on creating several drastically different environments for consideration.

Refine the level sketches. Prioritize the environment that best complements the gameplay and supports the game's narrative. Start blocking out the main pathways in Unreal Engine. Time to get hands-on!
Lunch Time. Grabbing some fast food with @3dmod-1 and @cdev-1.
Continue blocking out the main pathways and areas in Unreal Engine. Focus on ensuring good flow and pacing. Implement basic navigation mesh.

Initial playtest of the blocked-out level. Identify any areas that feel clunky or confusing. Make notes for adjustments. Send an email to @Qtest-1 for feedback and a formal playtest later in the week. @Qtest-1 , could you give me some feedback of my level design?
Address immediate issues identified during the initial playtest. Minor tweaks to pathing and area sizes. Save work and plan for tomorrow's tasks.
